intro: Sphaerostephanos omatianus, commonly known as the Ethiopian starfruit, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub native to Ethiopia, characterized by its small, star-shaped yellow fruits. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pink in color. The fruit is edible, though its flavor is generally described as bland or slightly acidic.
